WorkItem.ClosedComment: Closed as not an issue - the documentation indicates quite clearly that all formulae should use English language function names, and a comma (,) argument separator... and details the methods available for translating formulae from various languages including French to English, and back again.
WorkItem.Description:
I am currently trying to put hypertext links in my excel files. In my code I try directly to put the formula [ =LIEN_HYPERTEXTE("http://website.com";"xxxx")' ] (which is the french equivalent of "Hyperlink") , which gives :
 
$link = '=LIEN_HYPERTEXTE("'.$url.'";"'.$text.'")';
$sheet->setCellValueByColumnAndRow(2, $x, $link); //Where $x is a variable corresponding to the number line.
 
When I generate my Excel file (.xlsx) with my program, if I try to open it, Excel tells me that the file is not well formated or that its extension is not valid. Do you have any idea, where does this problem come from ?
 
Thanks in advance, 
 
Raphaël

Comments.Message: Formula must be defined in English, you can use the internal translation functions if you want to use french language function names
